page.title: 09ST MARY'S SCHOOL LUGWARDINE
page.content: St Mary's Roman Catholic High School lies outside the City of Hereford in the village of Lugwardine. Although formerly much of the teaching and administration was carried out by nuns from the neighbouring convent (now relocated), the school is now controlled by the Hereford and Worcester County Council. The school admits children in the 11 to 16 age group from a wide area. Many of the children are "bused" in. The school achieves high academic standards but it also enjoys a good reputation with its remedial teaching and the teaching of the deaf and those with other handicaps. A wide range of extra curricular activities is offered, including orchestra, choir, drama, swimming, gymnastics, chess and computing. There are also excellent sport facilities.
